Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label two different habitats, one on land and one in water (e.g., a garden and a pond).
The student can include at least two different types of plants for each habitat in their drawings (e.g., trees, grasses, or bushes in a garden; water lilies or algae in a pond).
The student can include at least two different types of animals for each habitat in their drawings (e.g., birds or squirrels in a garden; fish or frogs in a pond).
The student can compare the diversity of living things in the two habitats by showing differences in types of plants and animals.
The student can identify patterns, such as the types of animals found in water compared to those found on land.
